hive.model.base module¶

class hive.model.base.Base[source]¶

Bases: tuple

Represents a base within the simulation.

Parameters

  • id (str) – unique base id.

  • geoid (GeoId) – location of base.

  • total_stalls (int) – total number of parking stalls.

  • available_stalls (int) – number of available parking stalls.

  • station_id (Optional[StationId]) – Optional station that is located at the base.

  • sim_h3_resolution (int) – the h3 resolution that events are experienced at

Return type

Returns

a Base, or an error

hive.model.coordinate.dist_euclidian(a, b)[source]¶

Calculate the euclidian distance between two coordinates.

Warning

Calculating euclidian distance on latitude and longitude will introduce some error.

Parameters

  • a (Coordinate) – Coordinate a

  • b (Coordinate) – Coordinate b

Return type

float

Returns

unitless distance between the two coordinates

  • b (Coordinate) – Coordinate b

Return type

km

Returns

Distance between the two points in kilometers.

hive.model.coordinate.interpolate_between_coordinates(a, b, ratio)[source]¶

Interpolate a new coordinate between two coordinates given a ratio using linear interpolation.

Warning

Using linear interpolation with latitude and longitude will introduce some error.

Parameters

  • a (Coordinate) – Coordinate a

  • b (Coordinate) – Coordinate b

  • ratio (float) – ratio from a -> b

Return type

Coordinate

Returns

new interpolated Coordinate

class hive.model.passenger.Passenger[source]¶

Bases: tuple

A tuple representing a passenger in the simulation.

Parameters

  • id (PassengerId) – the unique id of the passenger

  • origin (GeoId) – the pickup location of the passenger

  • destination (GeoId) – the destination location of the passenger

  • departure_time (SimTime) – the departure time of the passenger

  • vehicle_id (Optional[VehicleId]) – id of the vehicle that the passenger is occupying

hive.model.request module¶

class hive.model.request.Request[source]¶

Bases: tuple

A ride hail request which is alive in the simulation but not yet serviced. It should only exist if the current sim time >= self.departure_time. It should be removed once the current sim time == self.cancel_time. If a vehicle has been dispatched to service this Request, then it should hold the vehicle id and the time that vehicle was dispatched to it.

Parameters

  • id (RequestId) – A unique id for the request.

  • origin (GeoId) – The geoid of the request origin.

  • destination (GeoId) – The geoid of the request destination.

  • departure_time (SimTime) – The time of departure.

  • cancel_time (SimTime) – The time when this request will cancel.

  • passengers (Tuple[Passenger]) – A tuple of passengers associated with this request.

  • dispatched_vehicle (Optional[VehicleId]) – The id of the vehicle dispatched to service this request.

  • dispatched_vehicle_time (Optional[SimTime]) – Time time which a vehicle was dispatched for this request.

classmethod from_row(row, road_network)[source]¶

takes a csv row and turns it into a Request

Parameters

  • row (Dict[str, str]) – a row as interpreted by csv.DictReader

  • road_network (RoadNetwork) – the road network loaded for this simulation

Return type

Union[OSError, Request]

Returns

a Request, or an error

assign_dispatched_vehicle(vehicle_id, current_time)[source]¶

allows the dispatcher to update the request that a vehicle has been dispatched to them. this does not signal that the vehicle is guaranteed to pick them up.

Parameters

  • vehicle_id (str) – the vehicle that is planning to service the request

  • current_time (int) – the current simulation time

Return type

Request

Returns

the updated Request

update_origin(geoid)[source]¶

used to override a request’s origin location as the centroid of the spatial grid, to make guarantees about what conditions will make requests overlap with vehicles.

Parameters

geoid (str) – The new request origin

Return type

Request

Returns

The updated request

hive.model.station module¶

class hive.model.station.Station[source]¶

Bases: tuple

A station that vehicles can use to refuel

Parameters

  • id (StationId) – The unique id of the station.

  • geoid (Geoid) – The location of the station.

  • total_chargers (Dict[Charger, int]) – A map of the charger types and quanitites for this station.

  • available_chargers (Dict[Charger, int]) – Identifies how many plugs for each charger type are unoccupied.

total_chargers¶
available_chargers¶
classmethod from_row(row, builder, sim_h3_resolution)[source]¶

takes a csv row and turns it into a Station

Parameters

  • row (Dict[str, str]) – a row as interpreted by csv.DictReader

  • builder (Dict[str, Station]) – the (partially-completed) collection of stations. needed in the case

that there already was a row parsed for this station :type sim_h3_resolution: int :param sim_h3_resolution: the h3 resolution that events are experienced at :rtype: Union[OSError, Station] :return: a Station, or an error

return_charger(charger)[source]¶

Returns a charger of type charger to the station. Raises exception if available chargers exceeds total chargers

Parameters

charger (Charger) – Charger to be returned

Return type

Station

Returns

The updated station with returned charger

classmethod from_string(string, road_network)[source]¶

reads a csv row from file to generate a Vehicle

Parameters

string (str) – a row of a .csv which matches hive.util.pattern.vehicle_regex.

this string will be stripped of whitespace characters (no spaces allowed in names!) :type road_network: RoadNetwork :param road_network: the road network, used to find the vehicle’s location in the sim :rtype: Union[OSError, Vehicle] :return: a vehicle, or, an IOError if failure occurred.

add_passengers(new_passengers)[source]¶

loads some passengers onto this vehicle :param self: :type new_passengers: Tuple[Passenger, …] :param new_passengers: the set of passengers we want to add :rtype: Vehicle :return: the updated vehicle

charge(powercurve, duration)[source]¶

applies a charge event to a vehicle :type powercurve: Powercurve :param powercurve: the vehicle’s powercurve model :param charger: the charger provided by the station :type duration: Unit :param duration: duration of this time step :rtype: Vehicle :return: the updated Vehicle

move(road_network, power_train, time_step)[source]¶

Moves the vehicle and consumes energy. :type road_network: RoadNetwork :param road_network: :type power_train: Powertrain :param power_train: :type time_step: Unit :param time_step: :rtype: Optional[Vehicle] :return: the updated vehicle or None if moving is not possible.
